menuItems.name: Filter Coffee
menuItems.description: Indian filter coffee is a coffee drink made by mixing frothed and boiled milk with the decoction obtained by brewing finely ground coffee powder in a traditional Indian filter.

menuItems.name: Masala Chai
menuItems.description: Masala chai is a flavoured tea beverage made by brewing black tea with a mixture of aromatic Indian spices and herbs. Originating in India, the beverage has gained worldwide popularity, becoming a feature in many coffee and tea houses.

menuItems.name: Badam Milk
menuItems.description: Almond saffron milk is a festive drink; this can be served hot or cold. Milk with blend of nuts and flavored with saffron to give a beautiful orange-yellow color and distinctive flavor and aroma.

menuItems.name: Masala Dosa
menuItems.description: Masala dosa or Masale Dose is a variant of the popular South Indian food dosa and has its origins in Tuluva Mangalorean cuisine made popular by the Udupi hotels all over India.

menuItems.name: Neer Dosa
menuItems.description: Neer dosa or Neer dose literally meaning Water dosa is a crÃªpe prepared from rice batter. It is light type of dosa, an Indian dish.

menuItems.name: Idli
menuItems.description: Idli is a traditional breakfast in South Indian households. Idli is a savoury cake that is popular throughout India and neighbouring countries like Sri Lanka The cakes are usually four to five inches in diameter and are made by steaming a batter consisting of fermented black lentils (de-husked) and rice. The fermentation process breaks down the starches so that they are more readily metabolized by the body.

menuItems.name: Rava Idli
menuItems.description: Rava idli is a variation of the popular South Indian breakfast item, idli, made with rava or Bombay rava.

menuItems.name: Puliyogare
menuItems.description: Pulihora, Puliyodarai, Puliyogare or simply Tamarind Rice is a common rice preparation in the South Indian states of Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu.

menuItems.name: Lemon Rice
menuItems.description: Lemon Rice is a delicious South Indian dish you can easily put together when in a hurry. Serve Lemon Rice with a Raita (yogurt salad) and Poppadums for a simple yet tasty meal.
